pageContext.claim: “Mexico, in the last four days, has really done a great job on their southern border -- with Honduras, with Guatemala, with El Salvador -- of grabbing and taking and bringing people back to their countries, because they're not going to come to our country.”
pageContext.analysis: Mexico has been doing this for much longer than "the last four days." Trump threatened to close the U.S.-Mexico border, then he backed off and claimed Mexico had responded to his threat by beginning to detain Central American migrants at its southern border. But Mexico has been detaining and deporting Central American migrants at its border for decades. Mexican government statistics show that the country has deported people from Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador -- the three countries driving the migration phenomenon -- more than 2 million times since 2001.
